The song â€œGoats, Tea and Troubleâ€ by @milletgrain draws from a vivid, whimsical tale of nomadic life, magic, and mischief under the moonlit skies of West Africa. This performance marks the first chapter of an unfolding trilogy rooted in coastal folklore and desert rhythms.

This excerpt was captured during MEDITERRANEO â€“ I RACCONTI DELLâ€™ACQUA, a special performance celebrating the 25th anniversary of Tiziano Di Muzioâ€™s artistic journey with Centro di Formazione Professionale PROGETTO DANZA a.s.d. in Chieti.

item.title: ğŸµ Goats, Tea and Trouble â€“ A Nomadic Folk Tale Told Through AI Video and Original Music ğŸŒ™
item.author: Luca Cipressi
item.description:
Some stories arrive long before the music does. Goats, Tea and Trouble began as a slow-burning tale told under starlightâ€”a dreamlike fable set on Africaâ€™s western coast, where ancient spells, unruly goats, and firelit music blur the line between myth and memory.

This song is the echo of that story: a soundscape born from a nomadâ€™s bonfire, a missing cloth, and the quiet resistance of people who still live by rhythms older than time. Before you listen, read the story that inspired it.

item.title: Bass Guitar preamps comparison: Bartolini MK-1 vs. MarkBass MB-1
item.author: Luca Cipressi
item.description: A side-by-side teardown and analysis of the Bartolini MK-1 and Markbass MB-1 preamps, highlighting key differences in circuit design, switch behavior, and signal handling.
